{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.04303v1", "title": "Bott-Chern complexity of Kähler pairs", "summary": "We introduce the Bott-Chern complexity of a compact K\"ahler pair $(X,B)$.
This invariant compares $\dim(X)$, $\dim H^{1,1}_{\rm BC}(X)$ and the sum of
the coefficients of $B$. When $(X,B)$ is Calabi-Yau, we show that its
Bott-Chern complexity is non-negative. We prove that the Bott-Chern complexity
of a Calabi-Yau compact K\"ahler pair $(X,B)$ is at least three whenever $X$ is
not projective. Furthermore, we show this value is optimal and is achieved by
certain singular non-projective K3 surfaces.", "main_category": "math.AG", "categories": "math.AG,math.CV", "published": "2025-05-07T10:20:57Z"}
